text: WHO WAS KING ARTHUR?
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: King Arthur, who held sway in Camelot with his Knights of the Round
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Table, was supposedly a king of Britain hundreds of years ago. Most of
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the stories about him are probably not historically true, but there
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: was perhaps a real king named Arthur, or with a name very much like
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Arthur, who ruled somewhere in the island of Britain about the sixth
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: century.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Among the romantic spires and towers of Camelot, King Arthur held
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: court with his queen, Guinevere. According to tradition, he received
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: mortal wounds in battling with the invading Saxons, and was carried
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: magically to fairyland to be brought back to health and life.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Excalibur was the name of King Arthur's sword--in fact, it was the
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: name of two of his swords. One of these tremendous weapons Arthur
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: pulled from the stone in which it was imbedded, after all other
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: knights had failed. This showed that Arthur was the proper king. The
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: other Excalibur was given to Arthur by the Lady of the Lake--she
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: reached her hand above the water, as told in the story, and gave the
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: sword to the king. When Arthur was dying, he sent one of his Knights
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: of the Round Table, Sir Bedivere, to throw the sword back into the
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: lake from which he had received it.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: The Knights of the Round Table were so called because they customarily
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: sat about a huge marble table, circular in shape. Some say that
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: thirteen knights could sit around that table; others say that as many
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: as a hundred and fifty could find places there. There sat Sir Galahad,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: who would one day see the Holy Grail. Sir Gawain was there, nephew of
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: King Arthur. Sir Percivale, too, was to see the Holy Grail. Sir
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Lancelot--Lancelot of the Lake, who was raised by that same Lady of
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the Lake who gave Arthur his sword--was the most famous of the Knights
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: of the Round Table. He loved Queen Guinevere.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: All the knights were sworn to uphold the laws of chivalry--to go to
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the aid of anyone in distress, to protect women and children, to fight
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: honorably, to be pious and loyal to their king.

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur

text: "Who then has more right or reason to tell you of these things. It is
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: I who first picked you, long since, as likely finder of the Holy
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Grail. And when I found you slipping ever so little, and well you know
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: wherein you have failed me, I sent Merlin to all of you. For since he
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: on whom I had built my faith could not measure to the test I had
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: strong need to find someone else.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "For Britain must hold the Grail. Somewhere in it, there must be the
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: man who measures up to the test, high though it be."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Son, son, the things you could have done. The fineness of you,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: coarsened by the temptations you have met and not overcome. The joy
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: you have found in things that are sordid and count for so little."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Low hung the knight's head, His anger had left him now. In its stead
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: was a deep humility.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Father, you bare my soul. And yet have I striven. High did I hold
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the ideals which first inspired me, I have overcome much, have tried
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: to keep to the high set purpose. Yet I am but common clay, after all."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: finer scales than others. We ask more of them, seek more from them.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: mortal soul. Yet have we faith,--we believe."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: things that were wrong even as I did these things."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Yet, my son, a great task shall be yours. Now of the boy Allan." The
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: monk paused.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur

title: In the Court of King Arthur

text: Now King Arthur, his knights and all of his men were home once again.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Here they found great good humor at their account of the adventure at
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the castle of King Mark.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Tristram came with them. For many years thereafter he served under
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: King Arthur. Honor and glory he brought to the court of the King and
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Arthur held him in high esteem as well he might. Between Launcelot and
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Tristram there grew a great friendship. Each of them believed the
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: other to be the greatest knight in Christendom.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: And Allan, too. Now he was a year older. The urge to go forth, strong
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: within him, had grown that day a year earlier, when the strange monk
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: had met him in the forest and told him the things he might do. Youth
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: though he still was, not yet sixteen, he had learnt much. Sir
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Launcelot and Sir Tristram, too, had spent much time with him--could
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: there have been better teachers? Gouvernail and Walker, as well,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: taught him to make the best use of such strength as he had. So that by
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: now he was the equal of many knights, better, too, though none of his
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: teachers would let him know that, and he, secure in his own modesty,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: unknowing of his great prowess.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: The year, too, had brought Sir Kay's kitchen boy once again before the
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: King. Him, Allan had learned to know. Although his friend had never
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: admitted that he was better than his position warranted, Allan was
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: certain of it. When Pentecost had come again he was curious as to what
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: other boons were to be asked of the king by this kitchen boy.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: But the day found him away--sent to the castle of Sir Percival, which
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: was a half day's journey. Yet was he not altogether disappointed, for
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: at that castle was Yosalinde, Sir Percival's sister.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Again there were many who sought the favor of the King on this day.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: There, too, were many knights present and among these were Sir
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Gawaine, Sir Percival and Sir Launcelot, the three who had been there
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the year before.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "And so, sire," the kitchen boy said, when the king turned to him, "I
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: have done my work as best I could. Now I crave my two boons."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "These shall be yours, if we have it in us to grant you item. What are
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: these boons you ask?"
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "That I be made a knight by Sir Launcelot. Him and him only do I wish
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: to dub me with knighthood. And that furthermore you permit me to take
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: up the first adventure which may need knight to carry same."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "So shall it be. We pray you, however, that you give your name."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "That will I do, sire, after Sir Launcelot had jousted with me, if he
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: then finds me worthy of knighthood."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Of a sooth," said Sir Kay, "you ask not much. That so brave a knight
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: should joust with a kitchen boy is fit cause for merriment." Loud was
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: that knight's laughter but none joined with him.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Mayhap," said the strange youth, "it will be your pleasure to joust
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: first with me."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Uncertain seemed Sir Kay for a few moments.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I promise you, Sir Kay, mine is gentle blood, and you may well combat
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: with me," the kitchen boy added mildly.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Then did the two straightway prepare, horse and armor having been
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: obtained for the younger man.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Not long did they battle however, for the kitchen boy proved Sir Kay's
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: master right quickly. Whereupon, Sir Kay becoming furious, made great
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: ado to wound his opponent. But could not do so; instead, the other
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: brought him down with fearful stroke which crushed through helmet and
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: all.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "If you please, now, Sir Launcelot, to joust with me, I shall find it
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: great honor." So spoke the youth to the knight.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Then there was such a battle as none had seen in many months. Neither
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: of these two brought to play his full, strength, yet right cleverly,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: each struck, counterstruck and brought his skill to play. Much
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: marveled the knight at the youth.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Then finally, Sir Launcelot said.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Your quarrel and mine, youth, is not so sore, we may not leave off."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Truly, that is truth," replied the lad. "But it does me good to feel
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: your might."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "So tell me your name, that I may dub you knight. Right gladly will I
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: do so."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "My name," said the other, "is Gareth. I am brother to Gawaine. I made
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: vow to prove myself worthy of knighthood by finding myself able to
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: undergo the mean tasks as well as the noble ones."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: So Sir Gawaine came forward wonderingly, to see this brother whom he
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: had not seen since he was a babe.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: He made him fond embrace. "Right proud of you am I brother. Proud too,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: that it is Launcelot, whose knight you shall be."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Then Sir Gareth became knight. And as they made their way again into
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the great hall, the King beckoned to Sir Gareth.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Are you still of a mind to take on yourself the first adventure that
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: cometh. For here is one that promises a lengthy time in its
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: fulfillment."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Before the new knight could make answer, Sir Gawaine spoke.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "This sire, is Gareth, my youngest brother. Worthy of knighthood has
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: he proven so far as strength and skill go."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Then are we right proud to have you among us, nephew. And we pray
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: that you will add lustre to your honored name and to the Round Table
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: as well."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "That, I warrant, he will," vouchsafed Sir Launcelot. "Perchance, it
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: seemeth a wise thing to have Sir Kay feed all our knights in prospect
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the same fat broth he has furnished Gareth."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "As to the adventure," the King returned. "There came but a little
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: while ago a maiden, Linet, by name, who craves that we send a knight
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: to succor her sister, the fair Dame Lyoness who is besieged in her
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: castle by the Knight of the Red Lawns."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Good herald," the King continued, "bring you the lady, Linet before
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: us."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Into the great hall came a maiden fair. To her the king addressed
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: himself.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "My Lady Linet, and it please you, pray tell us of what manner of
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: siege this knight holds against your sister. If to you it seems of
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: avail, we shall be glad to send a goodly number of our knights and
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: yeomen, too, to raise this siege."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Nay sire, that I deem not necessary. Only, since I have heard that
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the knights of the Round Table are the bravest and best in all
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Britain, I have come to you that you send one of these to battle with
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the Knight of the Red Lawns. A stout knight is he, many have come to
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: rescue the fair lady who is my sister but the way is perilous and he
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: hath seven men's strength. So that I pray you to send the best and
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: bravest knight who is here."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: [Illustration: "My Lady, I Am Your Loyal Knight"]
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "We would gladly heed your request, good lady. Nor do we care what
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: manner of knight this is, if Sir Launcelot or Sir Tristram or any one
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: of ten or twelve more were to go to your fair sister's rescue. But we
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: have made promise that the next adventure, which this is, was to be
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: taken up by Sir Gareth and unless he forego this, there is naught else
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: left for us to do. What say you, Gareth?"
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I beg you, sire, that you permit me to carry out this adventure. I
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: shall do my utmost to bring it to successful conclusion." So did
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Gareth reply.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "And I for one, sire, doubt not, that if the adventure can be carried
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: out successfully, he will do so. For he is as brave and stout a knight
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: as is among us," added Sir Launcelot.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Yet is he so young," said the maiden as she sighed. "I doubt that any
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: of you know how powerful is the knight he must oppose."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Yet will he go," Arthur now decided. "Make you your plans Gareth. The
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: way seems long and I doubt not, you will be disposed to continue on
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: adventure's course, if this should be carried to successful
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: conclusion."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Now the maiden left the great hall. Sir Gareth joined Sir Launcelot,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Sir Percival and his brother. As he did so, there came to him, Breunor
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: le Noire.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I pray you to favor me, good Sir Gareth by permitting me to go with
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: you and gather for myself such adventure as I may."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Sir Gareth pondered for a moment, then made reply.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I had a mind to ask a boon of Sir Percival yet I can see no reason
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: why it would interfere with your going."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "It is this, Sir Percival. I know how much your page Allan craves for
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: some adventurous journey before he also becomes knight. Be so kind,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: therefore, and permit him to go with me."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Truly, it will be Youth seeking adventure. For each of you is indeed
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: youthful." So spoke Sir Gawaine, while Sir Percival thought before
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: making reply.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "What say you, Launcelot?" he finally asked.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "It cannot harm the lad to go with others than ourselves for then he
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: will receive opportunity to test himself. I would say that you permit
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: him, if he wishes it."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Then may he go," said Sir Percival. "Except that I would wish that
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: one of my yeomen, whose name is Walker, go with you. You will find him
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: useful and a willing knave."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "For that I thank you," replied Gareth. "Tomorrow, my friend," and he
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: turned to Breunor, "we begin our journey."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I shall be ready," replied Breunor le Noire.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur

text: of his armor, called Sir Gareth.

title: In the Court of King Arthur

text: make you gift of this horse. He is yours. That was not a true tale as
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: to who owned this horse. For its true owner is none other than you and
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: those who are in trouble, though the trouble owner be lowly born. The
title: In the Court of King Arthur

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Of the travels of Sir Galahad, of how he journeyed through many lands
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: and new scenes, there is much to be told. Ever with him, went his
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: faithful man, Walker, who served him well and loyally.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Eager was the young knight to reach Normandy of which he had heard
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: much. So he sailed away and since many rumors held the Grail to be
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: there he hoped to find it.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: In Normandy, a strange land, he met with much adventure, many knights
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: brave and true, and some who were not. But no sign of the Grail was
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: there to be had.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: lodging where he could.

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: It was so, in the first month of his travels, that he came to the
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: castle of one of the best of Normandy's knights. Of him, Sir Launcelot
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: had spoken highly; he held him in great esteem, and so had counseled
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: the youthful knight to make it his purpose to visit him when there.

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: England, well he knew Sir Launcelot and Sir Percival and the great
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: King himself. Sir Galahad found his stay a pleasant one; there were
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: friendly jousts in which he met some of Normandy's worshipful knights.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Sir Guilbert had full praise for the young knight. There was son of
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: his, a youth of seventeen, who also admired the newcomer, even as
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Allan the boy had admired Sir Launcelot. When his visitor's stay was
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: drawing to a close, Sir Guilbert spoke of this.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "My son Charles, Sir Galahad, has taken great fancy to you and wishful
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: am I that you could find it in your plans to take him as page. He is a
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: quiet lad, sturdy and obedient, you will find. And following wish of
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: his mother, he knows your English tongue well, for she is Englishborn.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: He has made study of Latin too, it seemed for a time that he would
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: turn to priesthood. But that will not be, and I cannot say that it
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: finds me regretful. I would have him a true knight, had I my way."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Your wish, Sir Guilbert, may well be served. But if I may, I should
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: like first to speak to the lad, before I make answer."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Faith, and you may. For we should want the lad to satisfy you and
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: merit your friendship. I shall see to it that you have the chance to
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: speak with him. It were better, that he know not the reason for your
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: questioning. Is it not so?"
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "It would be best, Sir Guilbert," Sir Galahad replied.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Then the two talked of other things and the young knight questioned
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: his friend as to the likely whereabouts of the Holy Grail.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Many rumors have I heard, Sir Galahad. But never actual trace.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Understand you well, my friend. Knights from every land seek this
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Grail and I would wish that it were Norman who found it. But if it
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: cannot be one from my own land, I would it were one from your country.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: I fear me, it shall not be easy search, it may lead you far."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I am well prepared for that," replied the Seeker. "If it were easy to
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: find, the glory would be so much the less. I can but hope that I shall
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: have the vision to see it when it is near me."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: dining hall for the meal waits."

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: hold speech with the youth, Charles.

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "There is much to see and I envy the many who have traveled to foreign
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: lands."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: infidels."

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur

title: In the Court of King Arthur

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: The Knight waited but a few moments when his hostess came into the
title: In the Court of King Arthur

text: room.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "You are gracious, Sir Galahad. I doubt whether there can be any help
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: for me. Yet I shall tell you my story for there still may be hope for
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: so wretched a person as myself."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "My lady, it is the duty of all true knights to be of help to those in
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: distress. Wherefore, I hold but to my knightly vow, in my promise of
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: service to you."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur

text: The Lady Jeanne made no answer, seemingly she had not heard him. Sir
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Galahad watched her, saw her look which seemed afar, saw the dark rims
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: around her eyes. They spoke of many hours of weeping.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Now she turned to him.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I think, my lord, this storm that seems as if it will not cease has
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: been sent by God. Strange though it may seem it brings me hope, dim
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: though that hope may be, yet I treasure it. Little reason for hope
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: have I had.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Think me not rude, Sir Galahad, and think not that I question your
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: valor or skill. But this is task for no lone knight, for my enemy is
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: strong and powerful. I may be selfish too, in that I draw you into my
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: troubles but I am like one who drowning, must need snatch at a straw.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: And many knights would hesitate long to offer service where the cause
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: is as hopeless as mine seemingly is. Nor will I blame you or hold you,
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: if after my story is done, you find no way in which you can help me.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Listen then and you will see why I count this storm as sign of hope
title: In the Court of King Arthur

text: sent to me."

text: Two years will it be next month when the Duke of Gascony with fifty
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: knights went forth on a quest that would take them to far Eastern
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: lands. Of these fifty, Sir Vilard, my husband, was one.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "He left with me, my son Ambrose, my daughter Helene and two
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: servitors, old men who could not go with him. It was in a good and
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: holy cause so I had no tears for him to see. Rather did I bid him
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Godspeed and a safe and quick return.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "You see me alone now. Two years, and I have neither son, nor
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: daughter, nor husband. Did I know they were dead, bitter would be my
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: woe yet would I count God's mercies many, His ways strange, but not
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: for any mortal to question. But I do not know that. They would have me
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: believe my husband dead. Ambrose went forth one day and I have had no
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: word of him since then. And my daughter is lodged within prison walls
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: waiting the whim of Sir Dolphus who holds her in his power.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "They tell me that my husband perished with the Duke and all but three
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: of the knights that went forth with him. And that before he died he
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: sent word that it was his wish that I permit Sir Dolphus to marry our
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: daughter. Yet do I know that Sir Dolphus is already lawfully wedded to
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: a wife whom he would discard. Knowing my husband as I do, I could not
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: believe such to be his message. So I withstood the pleadings of this
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: knight until his pleadings turned to bitter threats.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "He would make himself Duke of Gascony. And when I would not listen to
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: him, his pleadings or threats, he came here one day with two other
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: knights and professed to abide by such decision as I had made. They
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: dined with us. Ambrose, my son, was away that day.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "Enough to say that they stole my daughter from me. This old man you
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: see and the other, Albert, were clubbed to earth, the one to death. I
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: tried so hard to resist them but my hand was weak.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "When Ambrose returned, I could not keep him. He went forth to rescue
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: his sister. Poor lad, I have had no word from him since then. Is he
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: dead? Did they kill him? I have sent for word, have begged that they
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: tell me what fate has befallen him but they profess not to know.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I have heard that the Church will not sanction his marriage to
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: Helene. Nor will it permit Sir Dolphus to annul the marriage with his
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: wife. A good priest also tells me that Sir Dolphus has set his black
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: heart upon marrying my poor Helene so that he can then lawfully own
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: all this land and estate that belongs to us. It will be small matter
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: to rid himself of me and I fain would not wish to live were it not
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: that I still have hope.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "My lord, I have hoped so much. Until my very hope turned black for
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: never was there any one so helpless against the power of this wicked
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: man. I dread the coming of each day and yet mixed with my dread there
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: still is ever present that one small hope which will not be killed.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "I think I would have died but for this small hope," she added
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: wistfully. She paused now and seemed lost in the dark thoughts that
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: possessed her.
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: "All of them gone. Not one of them to remain with me."
title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur
author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

title: In the Court of King Arthur

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)

text: of."

author: Lowe, Samuel E. (Samuel Edward)
